ControlledConcept.gml:description: A supergroup is a formal assemblage of related or superposed groups or of groups and formations Source: North American Commission on Stratigraphic Nomenclature, 2005; Salvador, 1994
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:StratigraphicRank:200811:supergroup
ControlledConcept.name: Supergroup

ControlledConcept.gml:description: A group is the lithostratigraphic unit next higher in rank to either subgroup or formation. A groups may consist of two or more subgroups or two or more formations or a combination of both. Source: North American Commission on Stratigraphic Nomenclature, 2005
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:StratigraphicRank:200811:group
ControlledConcept.name: Group

ControlledConcept.gml:description: A subgroup is the lithostratigraphic unit next higher in rank to formation. A subgroup usually consists of several formations. Source: Salvador, 1994
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:StratigraphicRank:200811:subgroup
ControlledConcept.name: Subgroup

ControlledConcept.gml:description: A body of rock identified by lithic characteristics and stratigraphic position; it is usually but not necessarily tabular and is mappable at the Earth's surface or traceable in the subsurface. Source: North American Commission on Stratigraphic Nomenclature, 2005; Salvador, 1994
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:StratigraphicRank:200811:formation
ControlledConcept.name: Formation

ControlledConcept.gml:description: A formal lithostratigraphic unit next in rank below a formation, and always part of a formation. It is a named entity within a formation because it possesses characteristics distinguishing it from adjacent parts of the formation. Source: North American Commission on Stratigraphic Nomenclature, 2005; Salvador, 1994
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:StratigraphicRank:200811:member
ControlledConcept.name: Member

ControlledConcept.gml:description: The smallest formal lithostratigraphic unit, usually a distinctive lithic entity which can be distinguished from adjacent rocks by one or more physical characteristics. Source: North American Commission on Stratigraphic Nomenclature, 2005; Salvador, 1994
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:StratigraphicRank:200811:bed
ControlledConcept.name: Bed

ControlledConcept.gml:description: An informal term used for a body of rock identified by lithic characteristics and stratigraphic position. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:StratigraphicRank:200811:beds
ControlledConcept.name: beds

ControlledConcept.gml:description: A succession of strata comprising two or more supersequences Source: Haq et al., 1988
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:StratigraphicRank:200811:megasequence
ControlledConcept.name: Megasequence

ControlledConcept.gml:description: A succession of strata comprising two or more sequences Source: Haq et al., 1988
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:StratigraphicRank:200811:supersequence
ControlledConcept.name: Supersequence

ControlledConcept.gml:description: A genetically related succession of strata bounded by unconformites or their correlative conformitie, and typically had a thickness of 10-100 metres Source: Van Wagoner et al., 1988
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:StratigraphicRank:200811:sequence
ControlledConcept.name: Sequence

ControlledConcept.gml:description: A formal lithodemic unit next higher in rank to suite. It comprises two or more suites having a degree of natural relationship to one another Source: North American Commission on Stratigraphic Nomenclature, 2005
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:StratigraphicRank:200811:supersuite
ControlledConcept.name: Supersuite

ControlledConcept.gml:description: A formal lithodemic unit next higher in rank to lithodeme. It comprises two or more associated lithodemes of the same class (e.g., plutonic, metamorphic). Source: North American Commission on Stratigraphic Nomenclature, 2005
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:StratigraphicRank:200811:suite
ControlledConcept.name: Suite

ControlledConcept.gml:description: A body of predominantly intrusive, highly deformed and/or highly metamorphosed rock, distinguished and delimited on the basis of rock characteristics. Source: North American Commission on Stratigraphic Nomenclature, 2005
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:StratigraphicRank:200811:lithodeme
ControlledConcept.name: Lithodeme

ControlledConcept.gml:description: unit is not part of a defined stratigraphic hierarchy. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:StratigraphicRank:200811:rank_not_specified
ControlledConcept.name: Not specified
